abstract: The New York Times’s staff scours the Web for important and peculiar items. Tuesday’s selections include an article about how foreign companies are now avoiding American cloud computing services because of concerns that the National Security Agency might spy on them. Plus, a sobering measure on the rise of Internet censorship around the world.

headline.main: Today's Scuttlebot: Cloud Companies Face Fear-of-Spying Exodus
